elements.name: div
elements.desc: contains a subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.

elements.name: p
elements.desc: marks paragraphs in prose.

elements.name: l
elements.desc: (verse line) contains a single, possibly incomplete, line of verse.

elements.name: sp
elements.desc: (speech) contains an individual speech in a performance text, or a passage presented as such in a prose or verse text.

elements.name: speaker
elements.desc: contains a specialized form of heading or label, giving the name of one or more speakers in a dramatic text or fragment.

elements.name: pb
elements.desc: marks the beginning of a new page in a paginated document.

elements.name: note
elements.desc: contains a note or annotation.

elements.name: ref
elements.desc: defines a reference to another location, possibly modified by additional text or comment.

elements.name: name
elements.desc: contains a proper noun or noun phrase.

elements.name: rs
elements.desc: contains a general purpose name or referring string.

elements.name: num
elements.desc: supplies the value of the number in standard form.

elements.name: measure
elements.desc: specifies the type of measurement in any convenient typology.

elements.name: time
elements.desc: contains a phrase defining a time of day in any format.

elements.name: date
elements.desc: contains a date in any format.

elements.name: email
elements.desc:
contains an email address identifying a location to which
        email messages can be delivered.

elements.name: expan
elements.desc: contains the expansion of an abbreviation.

elements.name: abbr
elements.desc: the abbreviation is for a geographic name.

elements.name: orig
elements.desc:
contains a reading which is marked as following the original, rather than being normalized
        or corrected.

elements.name: supplied
elements.desc:
one or more words indicating why the text has had to be supplied, e.g.
      <mentioned>overbinding</mentioned>, <mentioned>faded-ink</mentioned>, <mentioned>lost-folio</mentioned>, <mentioned>omitted-in-original</mentioned>.

elements.name: corr
elements.desc: contains the correct form of a passage apparently erroneous in the copy text.

elements.name: reg
elements.desc: contains a reading which has been regularized or normalized in some sense.

elements.name: unclear
elements.desc: damage results from smoke

elements.name: del
elements.desc:
contains a letter, word, or passage deleted, marked as deleted, or otherwise indicated as
    superfluous or spurious in the copy text by an author, scribe, or a previous annotator or corrector.

elements.name: sic
elements.desc: contains text reproduced although apparently incorrect or inaccurate.

elements.name: add
elements.desc:
contains letters, words, or phrases inserted in the source
  text by an author, scribe, or a previous annotator or corrector.

elements.name: term
elements.desc:
contains a single-word, multi-word, or symbolic
    designation which is regarded as a technical term.

elements.name: foreign
elements.desc:
identifies a word or phrase as belonging to some language other than that of the
                surrounding text.

elements.name: title
elements.desc:
descriptive paraphrase of the work
functioning as a title

elements.name: hi
elements.desc:
marks a word or phrase as graphically distinct from the
        surrounding text, for reasons concerning which no claim is
        made.

elements.name: rhyme
elements.desc:
provides a label
      (usually a single letter) to identify which part of a rhyme scheme this rhyming string
        instantiates.

elements.name: seg
elements.desc: represents any segmentation of text below the <soCalled>chunk</soCalled> level.

elements.name: s
elements.desc: contains a sentence-like division of a text.

elements.name: measure
elements.desc: specifies the type of measurement in any convenient typology.

xml:id.description: provides a unique identifier for the element bearing the attribute.

n.description:
gives a number (or other label) for an element, which is not necessarily unique within
        the document.

xml:lang.description:
indicates the language of the element content using a <soCalled>tag</soCalled> generated
        according to <ref target="http://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/bcp/bcp47.txt">BCP 47</ref>.

xml:base.description:
provides a base URI reference with which applications can resolve relative URI
        references into absolute URI references.

xml:space.description: indicates the intent that applications preserve all white space

valList.desc: signals that the application's default white-space processing modes are acceptable
indicates the intent that applications preserve all white space

rend.description: indicates how the element in question was rendered or presented in the source text.

style.description:
contains an expression in some formal style definition language
which defines the rendering or presentation
used for this element in the source text

rendition.description:
points to a description of the rendering or presentation used for this element in the
        source text.

corresp.description:
points to elements that correspond to the current
      element in some way.

synch.description:
points to elements that are synchronous with the current
      element.

sameAs.description:
points to an element that is the same as the current
      element.

copyOf.description:
points to an element of which the current element is a
	copy.

next.description:
points to the next element of a virtual aggregate of which
      the current element is part.

prev.description:
points to the previous element of a virtual aggregate of
      which the current element is part.

exclude.description:
points to elements that are in exclusive alternation
      with the current element.

select.description:
selects one or more alternants; if one alternant is
      selected, the ambiguity or uncertainty is marked as resolved. If
      more than one alternant is selected, the degree of ambiguity or
      uncertainty is marked as reduced by the number of alternants not
      selected.

ana.description:
indicates one or more elements containing interpretations of the
element on which the <att>ana</att> attribute appears.

facs.description: points to all or part of an image which corresponds with the content of the element.

change.description:
points to one or more <gi>change</gi> elements documenting
      a state or revision campaign to which the element bearing this
      attribute and its children have been assigned by the encoder.

cert.description: signifies the degree of certainty associated with the intervention or interpretation.

resp.description:
indicates the agency responsible for the intervention or interpretation, for example an
        editor or transcriber.

source.description:
specifies the source from which some aspect of
        this element is drawn.

org.description:
the immediate contents of this
		  element are regarded as forming a logical unit, to be
		  processed in sequence.

valList.desc:
no claim is made about the
		  sequence in which the immediate contents of this division
		  are to be processed, or their inter-relationships.

the immediate contents of this
		  element are regarded as forming a logical unit, to be
		  processed in sequence.
division lacks material present at end in source.
division lacks material at start and end.
division lacks material at start.
position of sampled material within original unknown.
division is not a sample.

met.description:
contains a user-specified encoding for the conventional
metrical structure of the element.

real.description:
contains a user-specified encoding for the actual realization
of the conventional metrical structure applicable to the element.

rhyme.description: specifies the rhyme scheme applicable to a group of verse lines.

part.description: this is the final part of a fragmented element

valList.desc: the element is fragmented in some (unspecified) respect
the element is not fragmented, or no claim is made as to its completeness
this is the initial part of a fragmented element
this is a medial part of a fragmented element
this is the final part of a fragmented element

type.description:
characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient
 classification scheme or typology.

subtype.description: provides a sub-categorization of the element, if needed

decls.description:
identifies one or more <term>declarable elements</term> within the
header, which are understood to apply to the element bearing this
attribute and its content.

hand.description:
points to a <gi>handNote</gi> element describing the hand considered responsible for the
  	    content of the element concerned.

valList.desc: the line is end-stopped
the line in question runs on into the next
the line is weakly enjambed
the line is strongly enjambed

toWhom.description: indicates the person, or group of people, to whom a speech act or action is directed.

who.description: indicates the person, or group of people, to whom the element content is ascribed.

ed.description:
supplies a sigil or other arbitrary identifier for the source edition in which
      the associated feature (for example, a  page, column, or line
      break) occurs at this point in the text.

edRef.description:
provides a pointer to the source edition in which
      the associated feature (for example, a  page, column, or line
      break) occurs at this point in the text.

spanTo.description:
The @spanTo attribute must point to an element following the
	current element

break.description: the encoding does not take any position on this issue.

valList.desc:
the element bearing this attribute is considered
to mark the end of any adjacent orthographic token irrespective of the presence
of any adjacent whitespace

the element bearing this attribute is considered
not to mark the end of any adjacent orthographic token irrespective of the presence
of any adjacent whitespace
the encoding does not take any position on this issue.

anchored.description: indicates whether the copy text shows the exact place of reference for the note.

targetEnd.description:
points to the end of the span to which the note is attached, if the note is not embedded
        in the text at that point.

place.description: in a predefined space, for example left by an earlier scribe.

valList.desc: below the line
at the foot of the page
in the margin (left, right, or both)
at the top of the page
on the opposite, i.e. facing, page
on the other side of the leaf
above the line
at the end of e.g. chapter or volume.
within the body of the text.
in a predefined space, for example left by an earlier scribe.

targetLang.description:
specifies the language of the content to be found at the destination referenced by <att>target</att>, using a <soCalled>language tag</soCalled> generated
        according to <ref target="http://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/bcp/bcp47.txt">BCP 47</ref>.

target.description: specifies the destination of the reference by supplying one or more URI References

evaluate.description:
no further evaluation of targets is carried out
	  beyond that needed to find the element specified in the
	  pointer's target.

valList.desc:
if the element pointed to is itself a pointer, then
	  the target of that pointer will be taken, and so on, until
	  an element is found which is not a pointer.

if the element pointed to is itself a pointer, then
	  its target (whether a pointer or not) is taken as the target
	  of this pointer.

no further evaluation of targets is carried out
	  beyond that needed to find the element specified in the
	  pointer's target.

mimeType.description: specifies the applicable multimedia internet mail extension (MIME) media type

cRef.description:
specifies the destination of the pointer by supplying a canonical reference expressed using the
        scheme defined in a <gi>refsDecl</gi> element in the TEI header

full.description:
the name component is indicated only by
one initial.

valList.desc: the name component is spelled out in full.
the name component is given in an abbreviated form.

the name component is indicated only by
one initial.

sort.description: specifies the sort order of the name component in relation to others within the name.

role.description:
may be used to specify further information about the entity referenced by
this name in the form of a set of whitespace-separated values, for example the occupation of a person, or the status of a place.

nymRef.description:
provides a means of locating the canonical form
      (<term>nym</term>) of the names associated with the object
       named by
      the element bearing it.

key.description:
provides an externally-defined means of identifying the entity (or entities) being
        named, using a coded value of some kind.

ref.description:
provides an explicit means of locating a full definition or identity for the entity being named by
        means of one or more URIs.

calendar.description:
indicates the system or calendar to which the
        date represented by the content of this element belongs.

period.description:
supplies a pointer to some location defining a
        named period of time within which the datable item is understood to have occurred.

when.description:
supplies the value of the date or time in a standard form,
        e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.

notBefore.description:
specifies the earliest possible date for the event in
        standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.

notAfter.description:
specifies the latest possible date for the event in
        standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.

from.description: indicates the starting point of the period in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.

to.description:
indicates the ending point of the period in standard
        form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.

when-iso.description: supplies the value of a date or time in a standard form.

notBefore-iso.description: specifies the earliest possible date for the event in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.

notAfter-iso.description: specifies the latest possible date for the event in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.

from-iso.description: indicates the starting point of the period in standard form.

to-iso.description: indicates the ending point of the period in standard form.

when-custom.description: supplies the value of a date or time in some custom standard form.

notBefore-custom.description: specifies the earliest possible date for the event in some custom standard form.

notAfter-custom.description: specifies the latest possible date for the event in some custom standard form.

from-custom.description: indicates the starting point of the period in some custom standard form.

to-custom.description: indicates the ending point of the period in some custom standard form.

datingPoint.description: supplies a pointer to some location defining a named point in time with reference to which the datable item is understood to have occurred

datingMethod.description:
supplies a pointer to a <gi>calendar</gi> element or other
        means of interpreting the values of the custom dating attributes.

evidence.description:
the intervention or interpretation has been made by the editor, cataloguer, or
            scholar on the basis of their expertise.

valList.desc: there is internal evidence to support the intervention.
there is external evidence to support the intervention.

the intervention or interpretation has been made by the editor, cataloguer, or
            scholar on the basis of their expertise.

instant.description: indicates whether this is an instant revision or not.

value.description: supplies the value of the number in standard form.

atLeast.description: gives a minimum estimated value for the approximate measurement.

atMost.description: gives a maximum estimated value for the approximate measurement.

min.description:
where the measurement summarizes more than one observation
      or a range, supplies the minimum value
        observed.

max.description:
where the measurement summarizes more than one observation
        or a range, supplies the maximum value
        observed.

confidence.description:
specifies the degree of statistical confidence (between zero and one) that a value falls within the range
        specified by <att>min</att> and <att>max</att>, or the proportion of observed values that fall within that range.

valList.desc: SI base unit of length
SI base unit of mass
SI base unit of time
SI unit of frequency
SI unit of pressure or stress
SI unit of electric resistance
1 dm³
10³ kg
1 hm²
10⁻¹⁰ m
see remarks, below
10³ or 1000 bits
2¹⁰ or 1024 bits
10³ or 1000 bytes
2¹⁰ or 1024 bytes
10⁶ or 1 000 000 bytes
2²⁰ or 1 048 576 bytes

unitRef.description: points to a unique identifier stored in the <att>xml:id</att> of a <gi>unitDef</gi> element that defines a unit of measure.

quantity.description:
specifies the number of the specified units that
      comprise the measurement

commodity.description: indicates the substance that is being measured

dur.description: indicates the length of this element in time.

dur-iso.description: indicates the length of this element in time.

extent.description:
indicates the size of the object concerned using a project-specific vocabulary combining
        quantity and units in a single string of words.

precision.description: characterizes the precision of the values specified by the other attributes.

scope.description: measurement applies to only the specified range of instances.

valList.desc: measurement applies to all instances.
measurement applies to most of the instances inspected.
measurement applies to only the specified range of instances.

reason.description:
one or more words indicating why the text has had to be supplied, e.g.
      <mentioned>overbinding</mentioned>, <mentioned>faded-ink</mentioned>, <mentioned>lost-folio</mentioned>, <mentioned>omitted-in-original</mentioned>.

valList.desc: damage results from rubbing of the leaf edges
damage results from mildew on the leaf surface
damage results from smoke

all of the text indicated as an addition duplicates
	  some text that is in the original, whether the duplication
	  is word-for-word or less exact.

part of the text indicated as an addition duplicates
	  some text that is in the original

some text at the beginning of the deletion is marked
          as deleted even though it clearly should not be
          deleted.

some text at the end of the deletion is marked as
          deleted even though it clearly should not be
          deleted.

some text at the beginning of the deletion is not
          marked as deleted even though it clearly should be.

some text at the end of the deletion is not marked as
          deleted even though it clearly should be.

some text in the deletion is not marked as deleted
	  even though it clearly should be.
the deletion is not faulty.

cause.description: documents the presumed cause for the intervention.

seq.description:
assigns a sequence number related to the order in which
      the encoded features carrying this attribute are believed to have occurred.

sortKey.description: supplies the sort key for this element in an index, list or group which contains it.

level.description:
the title applies to any unpublished material (including
                                                  theses and dissertations unless
                                                  published by a commercial press)

valList.desc:
the title applies to an analytic item, such as an
	  article, poem, or other work published as part of a larger item.

the title applies to a monograph such as a book or
          other item considered to be a distinct publication, including single
          volumes of multi-volume works

the title applies to any serial or periodical
	  publication such as a journal, magazine, or newspaper

the title applies to a series of otherwise distinct
	  publications such as a collection

the title applies to any unpublished material (including
                                                  theses and dissertations unless
                                                  published by a commercial press)

label.description:
provides a label
      (usually a single letter) to identify which part of a rhyme scheme this rhyming string
        instantiates.

function.description: characterizes the function of the segment.

datcat.description:
contains a PID (persistent identifier) that aligns the given element with the appropriate 
        Data Category (or categories) in ISOcat.

valueDatcat.description:
contains a PID (persistent identifier) that aligns the content of the given
        element or the value of the given attribute with the appropriate simple Data
        Category (or categories) in ISOcat.

notation.description: names the notation used for the content of the element.
